thread.title: How to pair beer with Girl Scout cookies
thread.title_full: How to pair beer with Girl Scout cookies

author: Lauren Delgado
title: How to pair beer with Girl Scout cookies
text:
Entertainment Restaurants Orlando Sentinel Foodie | Orlando Restaurants How to pair beer with Girl Scout cookies Lauren Delgado beer expert Matthew Stock said the many ingredient variations in beer makes it easier to pair with food.
Everything from cinnamon to coriander can be found in brews in the U.S. 
“There are just a lot more flavors in beer because of its larger ingredient list,” Stock said. 
Anyone building their own personal beer-cookie flight can either pair like flavors to like flavors - or use complementary flavors, depending on the cookie, Stock said. 
Stock gave us a few suggestions for the more popular Girl Scout cookies, but said that beer drinkers shouldn’t be afraid to experiment. 
They’ll be happy at the end, regardless of the pairing, because they’ll have cookies and beer, he joked. 
“There are very few wrong ways to drink beer and probably very few wrong ways to eat cookies and desserts,” Stock said. Caramel deLites 
The coconut baked onto the cookie gives it a tropical feel. Go with a beer that complements it with other tropical flavors - such as a German hefeweizen, a yeast forward beer that has banana and clove flavoring. 
Stock’s beer suggestions: Try the hefeweizen from Weihenstephaner or a local option. Peanut Butter Sandwich / Peanut Butter Patties 
If you have the opportunity to eat and drink something with peanut butter flavoring, go for it, Stock said. 
Stock’s beer suggestion: Terrapin Beer Co.’s Liquid Bliss. This chocolate peanut butter porter gives you a lot of peanut butter on the nose rather than on your palate (it skews a bit more chocolate in taste). Shortbread 
Shortbread cookies are one of the better options to pair with milk, Stock said. Pair it with a cream ale, which is brewed with lactose sugar (an unfermentable milk sugar). It’s a residual note in the beer, giving it a hint of creaminess and a touch of milky vanilla sweetness - a perfect way to complement Shortbread’s texture. 
Stock’s beer suggestions: Chameleon Cream Ale from Dead Lizard Brewing Co. or the Killer Whale Cream Ale from Bold City Brewery . S’mores 
All of the delicious s’mores flavors can be found in this cookie - the graham cracker, chocolate, marshmallow - but it’s missing the smokiness gained from melting a marshmallow over a campfire. Go with a beer that uses smoked malts such as a rauchbier, a German beer style that uses malts dried over an open fire. 
Stock’s beer suggestions: Try some beers from Schlenkerla Brewery , a German brewery that makes a number of smoked beers or the smoked porter from Stone Brewing . Thin Mints 
Stick with a simple pairing. Mint is such an overpowering flavor, opt for chocolate flavor such as a chocolate stout or porter, Stock said. 
Stock’s beer suggestion: Cigar City Brewing’s Jose Marti, a coffee porter with a rich chocolate note. Or, go with the Porter from Founders Brewing (which is one of the five best porters in the country, Stock said).
